io.github.daveho.funwithsound

Class Scale

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.daveho.funwithsound.Scale
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>

    public class Scale
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>
    A scale is an ascending sequence of midi pitches. A typical heptatonic scale will have 7 pitches.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int pitch)
        Add a pitch to the scale.
        Parameters:
        pitch - the pitch to add

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the number of pitches in the scale.
        Returns:
        the number of pitches

      • get

        public int get(int index)
        Get the midi note number of the specified note in the scale. If the parameter is outside the range 0..n-1, where n is the number of notes in the scale, then the note is in an octave above or below the default octave for the scale. E.g., for a hepatonic scale, 7 is one octave above note 0, -7 is one octave below note 0, etc.
        Parameters:
        index - the note in the scale
        Returns:
        the midi note number

      • hasMidiNote

        public boolean hasMidiNote(int note)
        Determine whether this scale contains the given absolute MIDI note number.
        Parameters:
        note - the absolute MIDI note number
        Returns:
        true if the scale contains this MIDI note number, false otherwise

      • findMidiNote

        public int findMidiNote(int note)
        Find the given MIDI note number in this scale, returning it as a scale relative note number.
        Parameters:
        note - the absolute MIDI note number
        Returns:
        the scale-relative note number, or Integer.MIN_VALUE if this MIDI note number is not part of the scale
